column2: requesting Statehood in the United States of Central America. A state constitution has been submitted

column1: EVTDESC17710;Communists have been distributing literature among the working classes in one of our states. They are claiming that the common man needs to rise up against the 'bourgeois' class
column2: and that rule by the workers is the only way they can obtain fair conditions and a truly utopian society. Government officials are concerned
column3: and some say that we need to crack down hard on this kind of talk.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC17720;The tense situation in one of our states has been aggravated by the presence of communist agitators
column2: spurring on the working classes to rise up against the government and institute a rule by the workers. We could step in
column3: but that might only provoke a rebellion. Allowing the agitators to continue spreading their propaganda
column4: however
column5: might let them get a stronger foothold in $COUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: with shouts decrying the state of workers in $COUNTRY$

column1: EVTDESC22516;$COUNTRY$ has suffered through the Great Depression
column2: but this year there are signs the country may be recovering at last. While the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ stock markets are still in flux
column3: with investors terrified and banks barely able to remain solvent
column4: conditions overall appear to be improving.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC22590;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ markets have shown increasing strength as of late
column2: and there are signs that industrial investments are prospering. Economists in $CAPITAL$ are predicting that $COUNTRY$ could see a boom in the years to come.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC22591;A recent string of very public failures in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ industrial sector have led to a cooling of the economy
column2: with bullish conditions ending earlier than was previously forecast.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC22595;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ economy has been sluggish as of late
column2: with investors becoming reticent to commit to new projects. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people have responded by tightening their belts
column3: making do with less... and while austerity serves its purpose
column4: it also has the possibility of sending us further into economic decline.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC22596;Early signs are that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ economy is doing better than forecast
column2: and the recession is coming to a close earlier than was thought possible.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC22606;Bankers are breathing a sigh of relief as the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ stock market shows signs of early recovery.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC22610;A fledgling stock and bond market has been introduced to $COUNTRY$
column2: particularly in $CAPITAL$ where a frenzy of speculative trading has already begun. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ economists are optimistic about the effect this will have on private investment
column3: though some have expressed worry that what goes up... may also come down. For now we enjoy prosperity
column4: but what will tomorrow bring?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC32509_NEW;We hear word from the Russian ambassador that they are willing to sell their Alaskan colony to us

EVTDESC32512;The Hungarian revolution in Austria sets a dangerous precedent. There are far too many minorities in $COUNTRY$ who might look to the Hungarians as an inspiration

column1: EVTDESC37219_NEW;The Paris Foreign Missions Society has been actively spreading Catholicism in Asia for many years now

column1: EVTDESC37710;A new line of the Bourbon family has been established on the Spanish throne

column1: EVTDESC44305;Perhaps inspired by the American Revolution

column1: EVTDESC44306;Lord Durham has returned from his mission to investigate the causes of the rebellion in Upper and Lower Canada with recommendations to the British crown-- namely that the two colonies be united under a single responsible government through an Act of Union. He fears that

column1: EVTDESC44351;Representatives from British Columbia have met with Canadian delegates in $CAPITAL$ to discuss terms of their joining confederation. The only thing that appears to interest them is the building of a national railway linking the Pacific and the Atlantic. Without it

column2: demanding a return to democratic rule!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44815;The rebel state of Tejas has been recaptured. A glorious victory for Mexico
column2: and a blow against the malcontents who seek to spread dissension and discord!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44820;Inspired by the success of the Tejas rebellion
column2: liberal malcontents in the provinces along the Rio Grande have risen up and declared their independence from Mexico.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44821;Angered by the abrogation of the 1824 Constitution and the centralization of government power in Mexico City
column2: liberals in the Yucatan have declared their independence.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the Mexican government will come after our country and seek to re-incorporate it into the federation. If we are to survive
column3: joining the United Provinces of Central America may be our only hope. Shall we make the request?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44825;With our capital under American control
column2: it seems we have little choice but to negotiate. The Americans have offered us a deal: the normalization of relations
column3: the forgiveness of our debt and the payment of a great deal of money... all in exchange for a cession of all the northern territories currently claimed by their country. If we refuse
column4: it may mean many years more of war for us until these Americans get what they want.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44826;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has signed the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo
column2: ceding all American-claimed territory to our control. For now
column3: the relations between our two countries can return to normal.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44827;Despite having them over the figurative barrel
column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has refused to capitulate to our demands. So much the worse for them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44830;Emperor Maximilian has never enjoyed popular support in Mexico
column2: and now that insurgents led by Benito Juárez have captured him it seems his reign has come to an end. Court-martialed and executed by a firing squad
column3: the new republic was declared only days after his death. Benito Juárez has assumed the role of President of Mexico.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: General of Mexico and considered a hero by some
column3: has overthrown the democratic government of Mexico in a military coup. Planned in secret with several military officers and announced in Oaxaca
column4: it has disavowed the presidency of Sebastián Lerdo de Tejada and installed Diaz as a military-backed dictator.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC45102;Juan Pablo Duarte has founded a secret society called 'La Trinitaria'
column2: seeking complete independence of Santo Domingo from Haiti and other foreign powers. Many Caribenos are calling the man a visionary
column3: and his ideas are gaining great popularity in eastern Hispaniola.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC46303;Porto Alegre is under Brazilian control once again. The gauchos
column2: however
column3: have promised to continue their rebellion against what they consider unfair rule from the throne. It may prove difficult in the coming years to keep the region calm.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Solano Lopez
column3: has turned his eye towards Brazilian lands to the southeast. Direct access to the Atlantic Ocean would be of great benefit to the country
column4: rather than relying on Uruguayan permission to use the river-- permission which might not always be forthcoming
column5: thanks to Brazilian interference. Perhaps it is time to flex Paraguay's muscle and establish an empire of our own?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC46605;Unrest is stirring against the Rosas dictatorship in Argentina
column2: with liberals demanding a constitution and a trasition to democratic rule. Justo José de Urquiza
column3: the governor of Entre Rios
column4: has approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government and asked us to support an uprising should Rosas refuse the liberal demands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the governor of Entre Rios
column3: has turned against the Rosas government and demanded that it submit to liberal demands for a new constitution. There are hints that neighboring governments might support Urquiza
column4: and that should he rise up in rebellion against us they will intervene on his behalf.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC46611;With Rosas unable to defeat the Entre Rios rebellion
column2: he has been forced to flee Argentina and General Urquiza has assumed temporary control of the government. Meeting with liberals in Santa Fe
column3: they have drawn up a new constitution which has created an Argentine Republic. The Buenos Aires province is displeased and vows to resist
column4: but the wind of change is clear.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC46612;The rebellion in Entre Rios has been put down
column2: and both General Urquiza and his liberal supporters have been captured and executed. The Argentine states have submitted to the will of Buenos Aires.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC49501;Members of the $FROMCOUNTRY$ government have approached us
column2: suggesting that the Kalmar Union must be ressurrected. For the moment
column3: this is simply an idea
column4: a suggestion that the Scandinavian nations should work together towards an eventual union. If we disagree
column5: it's possible that the idea dies here. If we don't
column6: $FROMCOUNTRY$ might be mortally insulted. If Scandinavians are to take their rightful place in Europe
column7: however
column8: perhaps there is merit in their proposal.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB49501;We see little reason to join such a union.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49502;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ proposal. It is now in our hands whether to let the Union die here and now
column2: or force $FROMCOUNTRY$  to join us whether they like it or not.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
I guess that's over then.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB49502;We'll see how they feel with an army in their capital...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: indeed all of Scandinavia
column3: which would remove the restrictions on trade between us.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC49504;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has suggested a political union between their country and $COUNTRY$
column2: arguing that this is the next logical step for Scandinavia's security.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA49504;It seems like a logical argument.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49505;Your Norwegian subjects seek to establish their own independent kingdom. The other European powers support their independence
column2: and will be upset if we refuse.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC49506;This time they are not asking nicely. Independence or war.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49507;Your Finnish subjects seek to form their own nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49508;Your Danish subjects wish to end our union.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49509;As our power in Scandinavia wanes and $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ influence grows
column2: so does the focus of the union move to them.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC60010;Concerned by the growing chaos in $COUNTRY$
column2: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ leadership has stepped in to declare martial law and assume full control over the government. Civil freedoms have been curtailed
column3: and already there is a growing certainty in the streets of $CAPITAL$ that this is the beginning of a military dictatorship. Will the new government be so quick to relinquish power once the current crisis has passed?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has awaited a contender who could unite $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$. Now that such a nation has arisen
column3: many feel it is time to surrender our personal sovereignty towards the $UNION_ADJ$ cause.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90016;One of the most prominent members of Austrian aristocracy has been murdered by a Serbian assassin
column2: a member of a group of nationalists who seek to rejoin with the Serbian nation. There are definite suspicions that the Serbian government has been secretly helping these nationalists and is behind the event.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90017;With the recent unrest in Hungarian lands
column2: the local Hungarian government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC90035;The government of Montenegro sent a demand for their lands to be returned to their control.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC90036;The Ottomans continue their brutal oppression of Orthodox Christians in the Balkans. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has been receiving calls for assistance from dissidents within the Empire
column2: and the feeling among our own Orthodox citizens is that we should take a stand to help our brothers of the faith.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90038;We have been approached by a Sardinian envoy
column2: the Count of Cavour
column3: who has made an interesting proposal: an alliance to make war against Austria
column4: gaining Sardinia the Austrian-held provinces of Lombardy. In exchange
column5: Sardinia would hand over Savoy and Nice to France. It is an interesting idea
column6: and one that allows France to take a role that would not paint us as the aggressors. Shall we agree?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90040;A mutiny by a group of sepoys in the service of the British East India company has ignited lingering resentment amongst our Indian subjects into open resistance against our rule. Should this grow out of hand
column2: all of our holdings in British India could be in jeopardy.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the ambassador from Sardinia-Piedmont has approached us with the suggestion of a pan-Italian alliance to retake the lost northern lands from Austria. A dangerous proposition
column3: to be sure.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90041;Polish peasants in Austrian-held Galicia have risen up and slaughtered wealthy landowners
column2: leading to calls by nobility within the Free City of Krakow for a larger uprising. Many in Austria are seeing this as a reason to end Krakow's independence once and for all.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90050;The duchies of Schleswig and Holstein have long been united and considered indivisible under the Danish crown
column2: but a question of royal claim to the duchies combined with the Holsteinian desire to join in the larger German Confederation to the south has led to considerable difficulty for King Frederick VII. The treatment of Danish people in Schleswig living under Holsteinian domination has led to a call for the duchy to be incorporated into $COUNTRY$ proper. This is unlikely to be looked on favorably by the conservative German aristocracy in Holstein.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90051;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ crown wishes to annex the Duchy of Schleswig
column2: which has long been considered indivisible from the Duchy of Holstein. The German aristocracy is enraged by this move. They believe their future lies with the German Confederation to the south
column3: but the Duke of Augustenberg has a stronger claim to Schleswig than the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ King. Schleswig-Holstein must forge its own path
column4: even if it means war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90052;Now that order has been restored to Schleswig-Holstein
column2: international pressure is mounting to uphold treaties regarding the region. Failure to restore nominal independence to the duchies and keep them united will result in tensions between $COUNTRY$ and other European powers
column3: and possibly war with the German Confederation to the south.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90053;King Frederick VII has died and left no heir. According to the recently-drafted constitution
column2: the crowns of both Denmark and Schleswig would pass to Duke Christian of Glücksburg. The crown of Holstein is more problematic
column3: however. The House of Augustenburg claims the crowns of both Schleswig and Holstein and is calling on German support. If the new consitution is signed
column4: Schleswig-Holstein will be officially divided. If it is not
column5: the Danish people will almost certainly rise up against their new king.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90054;The arrogant German aristocrats in Holstein have declared they intend to pursue a future with the German Confederation to the south
column2: and consider Schleswig an indivisible part of their territory. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ militants are angrily calling for the military to step in
column3: though some fear this may lead to war with the Germans.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90055;The question of Schleswig-Holstein's place within the German Confederation has now finally been resolved-- in our favor. This will have larger repercussions
column2: as the free German states will see that $COUNTRY$ is the true leader of the confederation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90056;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has brought Schleswig-Holstein under German control
column2: finally resolving its status within the confederation. This puts it in a unique position to assume leadership of the German Confederation as well as dominance over the North German states. We will need to take swift and decisive action if $COUNTRY$ is to maintain its position of influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90057;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has brought Schleswig-Holstein under German control
column2: finally resolving its status within the confederation. It's possible that aligning ourselves with $FROMCOUNTRY$ is far more in our best interest
column3: as well as more likely to create a united Germany under North German dominance. We should reconsider our current allegiances.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90060;The Ottoman Empire has been in slow decline for much of the last century
column2: but never has this been more apparent than in recent years. The Empire's hold on the Balkans is weakening
column3: and this threatens to upset the entire balance of power in Eastern Europe as Russia and other countries will inevitably be drawn into the conflict. Many in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government feel that it falls on us to call the powers of Europe together and negotiate a settlement that will restore some semblance of stability to the area.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90061;Now that plans for the conference in $CAPITAL$ are underway
column2: $COUNTRY_ADJ$ statesmen are busy trying to determine what our stance on the issue should be. Some feel we should favor keeping the Ottoman Empire strong
column3: in the interest of preventing the Russians from expanding into the Middle East. This could potentially improve our relations with the Ottomans
column4: as well. Others believe stability in the Balkans should be the priority
column5: even though this might come at the expense of the Ottomans and our relationship with them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90062;We have received word from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ that they intend to hold a congress of European powers in their capital to discuss the ability of $COUNTRY$ to maintain stability in the Balkans. Some feel this is a veiled attempt to carve up our nation
column2: and an insult
column3: but regardless we cannot let the congress go on without our attendance. We shall see what manner of 'negotiation' $FROMCOUNTRY$ intends.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90063;We have received word from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ that they intend to hold a congress of European powers in their capital to discuss the ability of the Ottomans to maintain stability in the Balkans. Some feel this is a veiled attempt to bolster the shaky Empire's hold over the Middle East and balk Russian 'aggression'. Either way
column2: we cannot let the congress go on without our attendance. We shall see what manner of 'negotiation' $FROMCOUNTRY$ intends.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90064;We have received word from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ that they intend to hold a congress of European powers in their capital to discuss the ability of the Ottomans to maintain stability in the Balkans. Some feel we should favor keeping the Ottoman Empire strong
column2: in the interest of preventing the Russians from expanding into the Middle East. This could potentially improve our relations with the Ottomans
column3: as well. Others believe stability in the Balkans should be the priority
column4: even though this might come at the expense of the Ottomans and our relationship with them. Still others feel we should not take part in this veiled attempt at dismembering a sovereign nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME90065;The Congress of $CAPITAL$: Keep the Empire Strong;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90065;The great powers of Europe joined together in $CAPITAL$ to negotiate the future of the Balkans. While there was much contention
column2: ultimately it was decided that the Ottoman Empire needed to be kept strong
column3: and any demands placed on it should not weaken its interests unduly. Few of the attendees were pleased
column4: the Russians in particular
column5: and even though the Congress favored the Ottomans it remains to be seen whether they will bow to European pressure and uphold the Congress's edict.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME90066;The Congress of $CAPITAL$: Stabilize the Balkans;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90066;The great powers of Europe joined together in $CAPITAL$ to negotiate the future of the Balkans
column2: with delegates from the Ottoman Empire also in attendance. While there was much contention
column3: ultimately it was decided that creating stability in the region was best even if it came at the expense of the Empire's power. The Russian delegates were pleased
column4: but Ottoman delegates left in a rage. It remains to be seen whether they will bow before the Congress's demands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90067;Our delegates have returned from the Congress in $FROMCOUNTRY$ with mixed news: though the consensus reached was that $COUNTRY$ needed to be kept strong
column2: they still placed numerous demands upon us that would see the political map of the Balkans rearranged. If we choose to defy the European edict
column3: we could be facing wars from many fronts.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90068;Our delegates have returned from the Congress in $FROMCOUNTRY$ with disheartening news: despite considerable dissension among those attending
column2: a consesus was reached that creating stability in the Balkans is more important that $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests and sovereignty. The demands are humiliating
column3: and will see us losing much of the Balkans if we agree. If we defy the Congress
column4: however
column5: we could be facing war from many fronts.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90069;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent word to the European powers that it will abide by the decrees of the Congress. This proves to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government they are serious about working with the rest of Europe to maintain stability.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC90070;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent word to the European powers that it will abide by the decrees of the Congress. This proves to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government they are serious about working with the rest of Europe to maintain stability
column2: though it is clear they are angered by the results.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90071;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decreed that it will not abide by the demands of the Congress. The Treaty
column2: they say
column3: is so much worthless paper
column4: and they refuse to give up any of their sovereignty.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90075;Egypt has been effectively independent for some time. Now it has become all too apparent
column2: and a threat to the vision of the Ottoman Empire as master of the Orient... something which has been little more than an illusion
column3: but which the Ottomans must either address or have it shattered forever. War will come
column4: and Egypt will either be beaten back into place and made to heel at its master's side or seek its own destiny as a power in its own right. Only time will tell.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90076;Egypt has been effectively independent for some time. Now that independence has become all too apparent
column2: and Ottoman mastery over the Orient is threatened. Either we must take steps to rectify the situation
column3: and assert our dominance once and for all
column4: or admit to the world that our power is little more than an illusion. There are those who feel that a peaceful solution is possible
column5: and that the Egyptians might better serve as powerful allies than as implacable enemies
column6: but that would require us to surrender our claim to Egyptian lands as well as be an affront to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ pride.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90077;While we expected immediate Ottoman reprisal
column2: it seems our former overlords are willing to negotiate. Their proposal is as follows: split the Levant between Egypt and the Ottoman Empire
column3: allow Ottoman influence to remain and they will permit our independence. Of course
column4: while this would retain an alliance with the Empire it seems like many to hardly be true independence at all. Still
column5: it would avoid a great deal of bloodshed.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90078;Our negotiations have been successful: Egypt has agreed to partition the Levant
column2: and we retain influence within their territory. While this spares us a great deal of bloodshed (and the possibility of an embarassing defeat)
column3: it does mean we have lost control over the Christian Holy Land in Palestine-- something that will not go over well with the powers of the world
column4: and with Russia in particular.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Egypt has refused to accept any Ottoman influence in their territory... and also refuses to give up control over any of the Levant. We have no choice but to take it from them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90080;The Turks have proven unable to retake the Levant from us
column2: despite all the assistance they have received from the rest of Europe. Even those great powers must now admit that the Levant rightfully belongs to us
column3: and that the 'Sick Man of Europe' has no claim over it.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90085;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have been watching the crisis develop in the Orient for some time
column2: and now that the Ottomans and Egyptians are at war it has become clear that the Empire's hold over its dominion is crumbling. Should the Egyptians successfully challenge Ottoman rule
column3: it could upset the entire balance of power in the region... something that many feel would threaten $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests. Still others believe that $COUNTRY$ must remain neutral
column4: despite the cost to our relations with the Empire.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90086;We have received word through the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ embassy pledging their support for the Ottoman Empire in our conflict with the Egyptians. This is heartening news.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90087;Our forces are on the run. It seems the hated Ottomans and their allies have won the day
column2: and we have little choice but to submit to their demands. We can try to hold out and turn the tide
column3: but it is far more likely that Egypt will simply be carved up into pieces by the imperialists if we do.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90088;The Egyptians have raised the white flag
column2: offering to abide by the Convention of London and return both Crete and the majority of the Levant to our control. Our advisors say that wresting control of the entire country is almost impossible
column3: and that we should take the offer while we can and let the Egyptians go.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90089;The Egyptians have surrendered to $FROMCOUNTRY$ and agreed to abide by the terms of the London Convention. Stability has been restored to the Orient... for now. All that remains is for us to decide whether to end hostilities with the Egyptians and return any $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ lands that we hold.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90090;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have been watching the crisis develop in the Orient for some time
column2: and now that the Ottomans and Egyptians are at war it has become clear that the Empire's hold over its dominion is crumbling. Egyptian diplomats have contacted ours through channels
column3: and suggested that support in its war would be appreciated and rewarded. The Ottomans
column4: they rightfully point out
column5: are after all no friends of $COUNTRY$. Such an act could earn us the enmity of the Empire and its allies
column6: however
column7: and thus feel we must remain neutral in the conflict despite the possible benefit to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90091;We have received word that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have pledged their support for the Egyptians in their conflict with the Ottoman Empire. If something isn't done it could develop into an alliance between Egypt and $FROMCOUNTRY$ that could lead to their intervention in the war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90092;We have received word that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have pledged their support for the Egyptians in their conflict with the Ottoman Empire. If we do not object now
column2: that support could lead to their intervention in the war. That objection
column3: however
column4: could also be seen as aggression on our part and harm our relations with $FROMCOUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90093;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have sent a demand through diplomatic channels that we back down from our support of the Egyptians. Doing so will harm the influence we have gained in Egypt
column2: but if we do nothing we risk retaliation from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
a Cuban intellectual and radical who has spent a great deal of time organizing émigrés in the United States
column3: has returned to the colony and declared the Manifesto de Monticristi
column4: an exposition of the purposes and principles of the coming Cuban revolution. It seems the uprising has been in the planning for some time
column5: and if the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government intends to remain in control of Cuba it could have a battle ahead of it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90115;To hell with Spain! Remember the Maine!\n\nA riot by Cuban Spanish loyalists recently broke out in Havana
column2: leading to the destruction of the printing presses of four local newspapers which criticized the Spanish Army. The battleship USS Maine was sent to Havana in response to fears expressed by the American consulate that Americans in Cuba might be endangered. Not long after arriving
column3: the Maine was rocked by an explosion
column4: killing 268 of the crew and sinking the ship in the harbour. American newspapers have leapt on the event
column5: painting pictures of Spanish atrocities which have whipped up the public into a rage. People are calling for war against Spain and intervention in Cuba.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90120;Three Filipino priests have been executed in the Manila
column2: charged with subversion. While the executions are said to have been just
column3: they are now considered martyrs by the Filipino people and have inspired the creation of a literary and organization known as 'the Propaganda Movement'. The organization consists of Filipino émigrés in Spain
column4: primarily liberals and students
column5: who are attempting to increase awareness of the needs of the Phillipines and foster better relations between Spain and its colony.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90125;We have received reports from colonial officers in Manila regarding rumors of a secret organization called the 'Katipunan'. Formed by anti-$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Filipinos
column2: they reportedly seek complete independence for the Phillipines. It's possible that limited home rule might mollify some of these revolutionaries
column3: but nothing short of freedom will satisfy them for long. Tracking them down among sympathetic locals may prove difficult.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90130;With the recent unrest in Cuba
column2: the prospect of the Spanish government possibly selling the island to the United States has arisen. Should we attempt to pursue negotiations?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
conducted in secret
column3: the Spanish have finally refused to sell Cuba. More than one member of the government has been angered by this
column4: seeing the island as naturally falling into the American sphere of influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90133;With no small amount of fanfare
column2: Spain has agreed to the sale of Cuba to the United States.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90135;With conditions in our Puerto Rican colony so poor
column2: the notion of independence has begun to spread among the local Caribenos. Reports from the colonial governor state a revolt has begun in the town of Lares
column3: one that may be difficult to put down.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90140;We have received reports of an independence movement having been formed in Puerto Rico
column2: with an uprising having been organized in the town of Yauco. While the movement doesn't yet have a great deal of support among local conservatives
column3: many of whom are hoping there is still a chance to achieve independence from $COUNTRY$ through peaceful means
column4: it's possible that their efforts could spread if we don't put a stop to it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95026;The Liberian colony was founded as a homeland for freed American slaves by the American Colonization Society. Now that Liberia is considered a financial drain on its resources
column2: the ACS is urging Liberia to proclaim idependence and find its own destiny.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95076;A spontaneous protest by young Poles against conscription into the Russian Army has quickly erupted into a widespread insurrection
column2: supported by high-ranking Polish and Lithuanian officers and politicians. The eyes of all of Europe are upon us
column3: and if we deal with the insurgents too harshly it may hurt our relations with European powers. If we do not
column4: however
column5: the uprising may spread even further.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95085;With the recent unrest in Finnish lands
column2: the local Finland government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95095;The Norwegian government has formally requested to be granted full independence from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC95200;A wave of nascent nationalism has begun stirring among the Turkmen peoples under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership. While the notion of a Turkmenian state is still a new concept
column2: the possibility exists for it to spread and even lead to full rebellion in time. We must watch this carefully.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95201;A wave of nascent nationalism has begun stirring among the Kazakh peoples under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership. While the notion of a Kazakh state is still a new concept
column2: the possibility exists for it to spread and even lead to full rebellion in time. We must watch this carefully.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95205;A wave of nascent nationalism has begun stirring among the Uzbek peoples under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership. While the notion of a single Uzbek state is still a new concept
column2: the possibility exists for it to spread and even lead to full rebellion in time. We must watch this carefully.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95206;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people are clamoring for all Uzebeks to be united under our flag.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC95210;A wave of nascent nationalism has begun stirring among the Tajik peoples under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership. While the notion of a Tajik state is still a new concept
column2: the possibility exists for it to spread and even lead to full rebellion in time. We must watch this carefully.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC95250;Brunei's control over the southern regions has only ever been nominal
column2: and the region has been self-governed under the Sultan of Sarawak. During a recent crisis
column3: an Englishman by the name of James Brooke provided the Sultan invaluable assistance in restoring order
column4: and has been bestowed with the title of governor. This 'White Rajah' is now effectively the ruler
column5: and is seeking alliance with Brunei. We must either recognize the independence of an area we only barely controlled
column6: or seek to assert our authority and perhaps anger the English in the process.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95251;The Dutch East India Company has been slowly spreading its influence within the East Indies
column2: and is urging our government to establish protectorates over the remaining sultanates on the islands. Indeed
column3: they have been stirring up trouble in the region. Many within our government feel that if the Netherlands is to remain a power to be reckoned with
column4: it must expand its colonial holdings.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95255;The call has been sent out for the peoples of the East Indies to unify under a common banner
column2: for protection against foreign imperialism and to usher in a new world power to make the Europeans tremble. The people are cheering in the streets of $CAPITAL$ at the welcome news. Will $COUNTRY$ do its part?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95260;With the end of the democratic government of the United States
column2: there is a growing feeling among many Americans that the principles upon which the country were founded no longer apply. Talk of secession is frequent
column3: if quiet
column4: and as unrest begins to grow it's become increasingly more possible that liberal-minded states will attempt to pull out of the Union. If they do, we must be ready.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95261;A group calling themselves the Sons of Liberty has secretly formed in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: advocating either the overthrow of the totalitarian American regime or the secession of $STATENAME$ from the Union. American law-enforcement is doing its best to hunt down these traitors.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
Americans have taken to the streets to celebrate their regained liberties. Flags of the Sons of Liberty are in evidence everywhere. Let us hope this new era holds
column3: and that the Union has not already been sundered beyond repair.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95265;A large group of secessionists have gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: among their numbers law-makers and politicians as well as angry liberals and members of the so-called Sons of Liberty. A vote was passed
column3: declaring the United States of America dead and demanding $STATENAME$ secede from the Union.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95286;A large group of secessionists have gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: among their numbers law-makers and politicians as well as angry liberals and members of the so-called Sons of Liberty. A vote was passed
column3: declaring the United States of America dead and demanding the states that form New England be allowed to secede from the Union.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95310;A new champion has arisen in the South, calling upon all Southerners to unite under the Confederate flag. If the North will no longer stand for Liberty
column2: than the South shall rise in its place. A huge crowd of $COUNTRY$ citizens have gathered in $CAPITAL$
column3: calling on the government to heed the call for unity.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95311;A new champion has arisen in the Nouth, calling upon all northerners to unite under the Sons of Liberty flag. If the United States will no longer stand for Liberty
column2: than the FSA shall rise in its place. A huge crowd of $COUNTRY$ citizens have gathered in $CAPITAL$
column3: calling on the government to heed the call for unity.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: some citizens have brought up the possibility of joining the Confederation of Canada. It is a land of freedom
column3: and together we will be more powerful than we are separately. Shall we approach their government?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95316;A delegate from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has quietly approached the Canadian government
column2: asking for the former American state to be admitted to Confederation. While this may seem like a good idea
column3: the Americans may see us as opportunists for accepting.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95502;Word has reached $COUNTRY$ of a great meeting of colonial powers in Europe
column2: wherein it was decided that African nations would be divided up amongst them-- as if our people were little more than children's toys discarded and left waiting to be picked up. This has caused a great deal of concern among those of our people with the knowledge to understand what this means. For others it has brought little more than resentment
column3: as well as vows to fight for our independence when the day comes.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95503;'We have seen the outsiders. They come
column2: with guns and riches we have never seen before. What they also bring is death
column3: and we must always be wary what lies behind their smiles.'\n\n$COUNTRY$ stands on good terms with much of the western world
column4: but our leaders are all too aware how quickly that could change. The Europeans believe we are not civilized
column5: and the tone of our contact with them is slowly changing from friendly interest in trade to a strange paternalism coupled with cultural superiority. For now
column6: $COUNTRY$ survives... but we must watch for the moment when the civilized nations decide our enslavement is the only way we can be 'saved'.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95504;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ muslims are calling for the Jihad to continue: all Islamic states of the Sahel
column2: united under one flag!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95508;A $COUNTRY_ADJ$ shipping company has come into the ownership of the Red Sea port of Assab
column2: sold to them by a local Afar sultan. The port would make for an excellent coaling station
column3: and perhaps even provide a base for $COUNTRY$ to expand our influence in the area. Pushing for more direct control
column4: however
column5: could cause tensions with Assab's owner-- who might feel they have greater right to the port than the sultan.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95509;The Red Sea port of Assab has been sold to $FROMCOUNTRY$ by the local Afar sultan. They have begun to use the port as a coaling station
column2: and fears within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are that they will use this base to expand their influence within $COUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the Ethiopians have taken advantage of the situation to regain control over the Eritrean coastlands. Though we may yet regain control over the Sudan
column3: we should consider whether the Eritreans must be punished for this trespass.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95512;The 'Age of Princes' is upon us. The rulers of Ethiopia must struggle to unite the land under a single Emperor-- and now it is $COUNTRY$'s time to act.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96100;A wave of nationalism has begun to spread among the Mashriqi
column2: fueled by their resentment over $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Our governors in the region are understandably nervous
column3: and report that we can expect major rebellions in the coming years unless we are very careful.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96101;We have been granted self-rule by our $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ rulers.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and many people in $CAPITAL$ are flying the revolt flag. They are demanding freedom from foreigner rule
column3: and we will have difficulty keeping them under control... provided that's what we wish to do
column4: of course.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96105;A wave of nationalism has begun to spread among the Bedouin
column2: fueled by their resentment over $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Our governors in the region are understandably nervous
column3: and report that we can expect major rebellions in the coming years unless we are very careful.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96106;We have received word of an uprising that has occurred in $PROVINCENAME$. A group of Mashriqi tribesman attacked the local $COUNTRY_ADJ$ garrison
column2: and were quickly put down. The $PROVINCENAME$ governor made a point of displaying their bodies
column3: hoping that would discourage others from following suit. It hasn't. Arab outrage has been fanned throughout $STATENAME$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96107;We have received word of an uprising that has occurred in $PROVINCENAME$. A group of Bedouin tribesman attacked the local $COUNTRY_ADJ$ garrison
column2: and were quickly put down. The $PROVINCENAME$ governor made a point of displaying their bodies
column3: hoping that would discourage others from following suit. It hasn't. Bedouin outrage has been fanned throughout $STATENAME$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: scion of the House of Saud
column3: has returned from exile in Kuwait. Not only that
column4: the man has managed to forge an alliance with the southern Bedouin tribes and retaken Riyadh. We must deal with ibn Saud quickly
column5: lest he retake even more land and reverse our earlier victory over his house.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96115;We have always been torn between our loyalty to Egypt and to the Ottoman Empire. The time has come to decide between them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96120;The House of Saud will never unite Arabia so long as the Emirate of Ha'il stands on our northern border. We must marshal our force and bring them to their knees.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96121;The House of Rashid will never unite Arabia so long as the Emirate of Nejd stands on our southern border. We must marshal our force and bring them to their knees.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96165;The Italians have managed to unify at long last
column2: threatening $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests in the region. We will have to decide whether it is in our best interests to object or to make friends with the new rulers. What has been done cannot now be undone
column3: after all
column4: and a united Italy could be a formidable enemy or a powerful $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ally.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96170;$COUNTRY$ has become the center of Italian nationalism
column2: its people calling out for unification. Italian flags are flying in the streets of $CAPITAL$
column3: and we must decide if we wish to support this call and bring all of Italy peacefully under our banner. If we refuse
column4: our people will be upset... and it's unlikely the opportunity will arise again.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96215;Nationalists have succeedeed in taking over $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies in India. Our governors have been driven out and our territory lost.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME97000;The Revolution of Maria de Fonte;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97000;A growing dissatisfaction with the ruling government among Portugal's poor has grown into rebellion
column2: spurred on by popular discontent with the prohibition against burials inside churches. The instigator of the initial riots is a woman by the name of Maria
column3: and her nickname has come to be used to represent the rebellion-- which has a large contingent of peasant women among its supporters -- and which has been co-opted by revolutionaries in emulation of the rebellions elsewhere in Europe.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97001;The Maria de Fonte rebellion has spread to $PROVINCENAME$
column2: with the lower classes rising up in opposition to the ruling government. Many are calling for the government's resignation
column3: and there are signs that Queen Maria II may engineer a coup to restore order.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97002;Portuguese forces have managed to restore order in the countryside
column2: and the peasantry have been brought back under control. The danger of a royal coup has ended.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97003;Spurred on by the spreading revolts in Portugal
column2: Queen Maria II has suspended the constitution and installed a reactionary government presided over by João Francisco de Saldanha Oliveira e Daun
column3: 1st Duke of Saldanha. This has served to spur on the country's liberals to outrage
column4: and begun talk of civil war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97006;Our forces are slowly pacifying the Angolan countryside. If we are fortunate
column2: we will one day be able to connect our African colonies.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97007;Our forces are slowly pacifying the Mozambiquan countryside. If we are fortunate
column2: we will one day be able to connect our African colonies.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97010;We have received an ultimatum from $FROMCOUNTRY$: surrender our colonies between Angola and Mozambique or suffer the consequences. The Portuguese people feel this is an incredible betrayal by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$. They have traditionally been our ally
column2: and now they are trying to bully our rightful colonial holdings out of us? It cannot be borne!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97011;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to our terms-- though they are unhappy about it.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and all but dared $COUNTRY$ to take their colonies from them-- if we can.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97015;Upon returning to Lisbon from a brief trip abroad
column2: King Carlos I and the royal family had their carriage fired upon by republican activists as they passed through the Terreiro do Paço. Three of the bullets struck and killed the King
column3: while another fatally wounded the heir to the throne
column4: Luis Filipe. During the turmoil
column5: the police killed the assassins... but the King and the royal heir were not saved and were pronounced dead at the Naval Arsenal soon afterwards. Manuel
column6: the king's youngest son
column7: has been quickly acclaimed as the new King of Portugal.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97020;With the monarchy already weakened by the death of King Carlos
column2: republican opponents have been able to gather considerable support in the capital. Members of the Carbonária
column3: republican youth
column4: and elements of the army have instigated a coup d'état in the palace. The young King Manuel and his family have reportedly escaped for exile to England
column5: and only days later a new Portuguese Republic has been declared in Lisbon.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: South Peru and Bolivia represents a threat to our interests. If the confederation is given time to solidify
column3: they could easily become a new powerhouse in South America-- and one that is no friend to $COUNTRY$. Thankfully there are signs that the confederation is unstable: the Peruvians chafe at the Bolivian leadership
column4: and given enough incentive they might withdraw. If we act now
column5: we might be able to stir our people against them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97055;With the recent losses suffered by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces
column2: confidence in the confederation has eroded. If we attempt to keep it together
column3: we must do so by force.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97060;Brazil has traditionally held the right to intervene in Uruguayan internal affairs as it sees fit
column2: but in recent months the conservative Blanco government has proven to be increasingly intransigent. The rebel leader of the liberal Colorados
column3: Venancio Flores
column4: has approached us with the offer of an alliance: place him in power and Brazil has a firm ally in Uruguay once again.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97061;After several recent political conflicts with Brazil
column2: they have sent an ultimatum: place the rebel leader of the Colorados in charge of the government or there will be war. There are many in the government who feel that Brazil cannot be serious. Uruguay is no threat
column3: and they would risk angering the Platine nations with an invasion? This insulting ultimatum should be refused
column4: according to them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97062;The Uruguayan government has rejected our demands. Perhaps they underestimate our willingness to see this matter to a swift end.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97065;We have no choice but to submit to the Brazilian demands. The Colorados are victorious.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97066;The government of Uruguay has given in to our demands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column3: has responded to his falling popularity by engaging in voting irregularities and seeking to annul the 1835 constitution in order to remain in power. This new constitution

column3: has risen to power during a time of crisis. To some
column4: he is exactly what the country needs to see it through these troubled times. To others he is a tyrant. In either case
